title: Chest cap
body: Why is there a cap to chests i can earn. I play well and get an s. i want to be rewarded but instead i just get told i have earnt too many chests recently.

replies.body: As much as people hate to talk about money, because in an already completely free to play game there has to be limits on the extra content people can get for free or the business model falls apart and everyone loses.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=McALKW7v,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-07-17T06:28:56.262+0000)
>
> As much as people hate to talk about money, because in an already completely free to play game there has to be limits on the extra content people can get for free or the business model falls apart and everyone loses.

If only Riot made actual effort into merchandising / cosmetics.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=McALKW7v,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-07-17T06:28:56.262+0000)
>
> As much as people hate to talk about money, because in an already completely free to play game there has to be limits on the extra content people can get for free or the business model falls apart and everyone loses.

What business model? You mean the model where you spend all your time on tft instead of fixing server issues? And you ban people for using a particular word that hurts your feelings instead of banning the people that play like absolute trash? You have no business model.

1. I'm pretty sure the team that designed and is balancing TFT is not the same (though it may overlap somewhat) as the teams that work on SR.
2. What server issues? If it's an NA thing, this isn't NA.
3. Why can't we ban abuse in chat *and* intentional feeders/trolls/griefers/etc? Since they're both breaking the rules and both negatively impacting other people should they *both* not face consequences?
4. I'm not a Rioter and don't run my own business, so you are correct I don't have a business model.
